Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Trump administration implemented the "zero tolerance" policy of separating immigrant parents from their children, not the Obama administration.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the Obama administration in building the cages by suggesting that they "built the cages that hold many immigrant children," when in reality, the facilities existed prior to the Obama administration.
Understate: The claim understates the responsibility of the Trump administration in implementing the child-separation policy and the number of children affected by it.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the Obama administration built the cages.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the existence of the cages during the Obama administration implies responsibility for their creation, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the facilities were established to address a spike in the number of unaccompanied children fleeing violence in Central American countries during the Obama administration.
